definition: Werner Heisenberg (1901-1976), German physicist/also written 海森伯
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

sentences.english: It was thus most disturbing to Heisenberg.
sentences.chinese: 因此這是最令海森堡煩擾的地方。

sentences.english: It would need someone like a new Heisenberg to find the escape from them.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要一位新時代的海森堡來找到擺脫它們的方法。

sentences.english: It is the Heisenberg Uncertainty Principle working with Murphy's law.
sentences.chinese: 這就是海森堡測不準原理和墨菲定律在起作用。

sentences.english: I was not afraid of Heisenberg's theory collapsing.
sentences.chinese: 我並不畏懼海森堡的理論會崩潰。
海森堡遇見了一個量子位。
德布羅意，海森堡和薛定諤。

sentences.english: Heisenberg gave us the uncertainty principle, which we will visit later.
sentences.chinese: 海森堡告訴我們不確定性原理，我們之後會看這個。

sentences.english: The story goes Heisenberg is giving a seminar.
sentences.chinese: 這個故事是說，當海森堡正在講座時。

sentences.english: Heisenberg continued to work on it.
sentences.chinese: 海森堡也在繼續這個工作。

sentences.english: Number 2, we are going to Werner Heisenberg.
sentences.chinese: 第二，我們來看看沃納，海森堡。

sentences.english: We investigate the nearest-neighbor entanglement in a one-dimensional dimerized Heisenberg model as a function of temperature and the magnetic field.
sentences.chinese: 研究了二聚化海森堡模型中的量子糾纏現象。
海森堡是波爾的博士後。

sentences.english: And Heisenberg says, no, but I know where I am.
sentences.chinese: 海森堡說，哦，不，我只知道我在哪裏。

sentences.english: This started with a brilliant idea of Heisenberg.
sentences.chinese: 它發端於海森堡的一個絕妙想法。

sentences.english: We studied the Heisenberg's uncertainty principle.
sentences.chinese: 我們學習過海森堡的測不準原理。

sentences.english: It would not have affected me as it would have affected Heisenberg.
sentences.chinese: 它並沒有像影響海森堡那樣影響到我。

definition: Ludwig Boltzmann (1844-1906), Austrian physicist and philosopher

pinyin: bu4 que4 ding4 xing4 yuan2 li3

definition: Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
Fermi (name)/Enrico Fermi (1901-1954), Italian born US nuclear physicist
